Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility due to membership in a terrorist organization
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: Membership in MQMH assessed as posing a threat to national security
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Affiliation with a designated terrorist organization
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Membership in an organization engaged in terrorism
Crimes.Admission_or_Involvement: Found to be a member of MQMH
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Prior involvement with a proscribed group
Crimes.Nature_of_Membership: General membership without specified leadership or operational role
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence and prior adjudicative findings
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Reliance on previous decisions without re-evaluation based on new jurisprudence
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Evidence deemed credible and sufficient for inadmissibility determination
Evidence_Issues: Lack of reassessment in light of new Supreme Court rulings
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 34(1)(f) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied; procedural fairness reviewed on correctness
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: PR application denied due to inadmissibility
Crimes.Process: Permanent Residence application process with concurrent Ministerial Relief pending
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Whether officer must delay decision due to pending relief and new jurisprudence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Alleged failure to consider new legal developments
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness, except on procedural fairness which is correctness
Crimes.Review_Standard: Correctness regarding procedural fairness, reasonableness otherwise
Crimes.Reasoning_Deficiency: Initial failure to address new Supreme Court ruling, but later corrected by appellate jurisprudence

Crimes.Crime_Name: Security reasons under section 34(1)(f) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: Membership in MQMH constitutes a danger to national security
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Association with a listed terrorist entity
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Being a member of an organization that engages in terrorism
Crimes.Admission_or_Involvement: Determined to be a member of MQMH
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Conduct linked to participation in a terrorist organization
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Failure to explicitly address new Supreme Court jurisprudence
Credibility_Factors: Designation of MQMH as terrorist entity
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient engagement with recent court rulings initially
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 34(1)(f) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Authority_Decision: Refusal of PR application based on inadmissibility
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Applicant found inadmissible and PR refused
Crimes.Process: Immigration admissibility and PR determination process
Crimes.Procedural_Element: Interaction between PR processing and pending Ministerial Relief
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timing and discretion in decision-making amid ongoing applications
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Whether failure to reconsider due to new rulings breached fairness
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness for substantive issues, correctness for procedural fairness
Crimes.Review_Standard: Correctness on procedural matters, reasonableness on interpretation
Crimes.Judicial_Review_Outcome: Application dismissed; no reversible error found
Crimes.Reasoning_Deficiency: Minor deficiency in reasoning regarding jurisprudential updates, cured by subsequent rulings
